alert.note: Alert for Northwest Plateau; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 24 at 1:25PM MDT until April 25 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL EARLY EVENING FOR THE NORTHWEST PLATEAU AND WEST CENTRAL MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .After scattered to isolated wet and dry thunderstorms Monday, strong west to northwest winds will develop over northwest areas on Tuesday with very low humidities. Another round of scattered to isolated showers and thunderstorms will develop on Tuesday east of the Continental Divide as a Pacific cold front plunges through western New Mexico. High temperatures will trend cooler with near to below normal readings behind the front. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Highlands (Zone 101) and West Central Mountains (Zone 105) Friday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 19 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
